Reviews.Title: “Old gem”
Reviews.Author: hannahcaroline
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is great especially for anybody wanting to shop. The main square just down the road is great if you want to catch the tour busses around the city. The hotel itself is a little dated yes, but there is nothing wrong with that. And yes it is extremely pink in the bedrooms but it is 'traditional spanish decor'. We had a sun-sol room which had a view over the street and a lovely large window. The only problem with the room was one night there was an usual and extremely loud noise coming from what seemed to be above. I couldn't sleep and it went on for about an hour. This may have been a one off I don't know, but at three in the morning it's not exactly what you want. The hotel does include food and drink. The drinks included are coffee, water, coke, soft drinks, wine, beer, ice tea and a couple other (which were not in use at the time). The wine isn't great but it was nice to come back to a beer after a long day walking around. The food was not anything special, but was perfect for a little six o clock snack (seeing as they eat at about nine in barcelona!). I am a huge foodie so I was always planning on eating out anyway. The staff were great and very helpful, always greeted with a smile. Next time I will probably stay in a hotel closer to the port, just so i can explore that part of the city next time. It's not a small place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona location, great deal”
Reviews.Author: Tim J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for four nights during a recent trip to Barcelona. We wanted a well-located hotel with minimal frills and a reasonable price tag. All of our needs were met. The staff was friendly, we got a great deal, and we were able to easily walk to Gaudi masterpieces, the Gothic quarter, and great restaurants. We wanted to spend our money and time experiencing Barcelona's extraordinary nightlife and dining scenes, and this was a perfectly adequate place to get some rest and refuel. If you keep your expectations reasonable, you'll be very pleased with the value of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful oasis after a day of touring”
Reviews.Author: travelmercies68
Reviews.Content: Two retired couples stayed two nights in late September 2011. I had selected the hotel for its location & excellent reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel was a mansion years ago & the decor is something out of the 18th century with decorative ceilings, walls & chandelier in the sitting-dining room; large mirrors & chandeliers in the hallways, etc. Rose pink is the color of choice for the 19 smallish bedrooms. The virtually 24/7 free buffet of assorted foods, including fresh fruits, salads, warm dishes to microwave, drinks of all kinds, including beer, wine, soda is a real plus. After a long day of walking around the city, we really weren´t in the mood to go sit in a restaurant for 2 or so hours. Sitting on the tiny balcony overlooking the street was a treat in the morning as well as the evening. Staff was very accommodating & helpful. Free internet. We took the Aerobus from the airport & got off at the University stop; the hotel was a short walk from there.We walked a few blocks to Gaudi's Casa Mila; a metro stop is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Mirjam”
Reviews.Author: Mirjami A
Reviews.Content: Oh my God, which smell! I reserved no-smoking room, but they gave like room with smell of smoking-room! This was their no-smoking room, and I can't imagine what kind of their room with smoking chance! And they didnt agree to change room. At first they promised to give money back, if I go to other hotel. I went to other hotel, but they charged my Visa later. Room's size was like cleaner's cupboard.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and quirky”
Reviews.Author: Katie M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Continental Palacete July 8-10 and July 13-14, 2011. We absolutely LOVED this location -- steps away from Las Ramblas and the metro -- with cruise ship-style free food and drinks (beer, wine, soda, juice, coffee and water) available 24-7. We enjoyed sitting on the 2nd floor balcony overlooking Las Ramblas and people-watching to our heart's content. We also liked the quirky pink style of the decor in our room -- which was tiny, but well equipped. We look forward to staying at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff and interesting rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BDiaz
Reviews.Content: The Continental Palacete is a hotel with excellent service, friendly staff, good location and very interesting rooms specially the bathrooms. We arrived in this hotel the second week of November after spending a week in Madrid and I was very impressed by the excellent location of the hotel. The hotel is located in the very sophisticated area of Eixample. The hotel is 10 minutes away from Plaza Cataluña and five minutes away from La Gran Via. Actually is located in Las Ramblas Cataluña. The staff is very friendly and they provided great service, they were always on top of everything. During our stay we were in room 136 and it was a charming room. This room has a big window but unfortunately we could not open the window completely. There are not rails outside of the window, so the window has a lock that only allows you to open the window a little bit. If you actually open the window completely you will fall out into the street. The room had a LCD TV, microwave, mini refrigerator and a safety box. Our bed was big, tall and comfortable. One thing that I want to mention is that if you are a petite person or a person with mobility issues, you might need to request a room with a short bed. The bed in this room was very height and even though I’m 5.2” I had troubles getting into the bed. The first two nights, I felt like I was sleeping on top of a table because of the bed’s height. Our room had a very interesting bathroom. The bathroom’s design is like a box with a glass ceiling inside of the bedroom (see the pictures). There are no windows in the bathroom and there is no exhausts fan so the bathroom and the bedroom were filled with steam every time that we took a shower. What was worse for me was that for those moments when we had to use the toilette, the other person had to leave the room, for a little while, so whoever was using the toilette could open the room’s window so the fresh air could come into the room and remove the bad odors. I know that the hotel is trying to protect the room’s ceiling and the wall décor which are charming, but they really need to install some exhaust fans in the bathroom. In general, our experience at the Continental Palacete was a very pleasant experience. But if I go back to Barcelona, I might try a different hotel in the Eixample area.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: israelaviv
Reviews.Content: We ordered 4 nights at this hotel, the location is perfectly reasonable near the Square of Catalonia, when we arrived we found that the hotel is very outdated carpeting dusty ,The room was outdated and did not justify the high price we paid for a double room deluxe with a window, we asked the manager to leave in the next day he was polite and agreed to charge for the night one, and indeed we moved to a hotel near by named Onix_Rambla_Hotel, much cheaper new rooms excellent location. we spent three more nights and it was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Part of Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: flahagan
Reviews.Content: We just returned last night from a 12-night Med cruise and stayed here 1 night pre-and post-cruise. I can't say enough superlatives about this place and the girls who run the desk. Simply wonderful! It felt like we were "home" when we came back after the cruise. The sitting lounge is so baroquely beautiful and was a great place to meet with our group of friends who traveled together. The included white or rose wine on tap, juices, Pepsi's and Estrella Damm beer, plus the nuts, olives, etc. made for a terrific happy hour. We were surprised at the selection of hot foods prepared at lunch - rice or pasta dishes, chicken, veggies, and all were yummy. Loved the selection of delicious breads as well. Yes, the rooms are a bit small and pink, but the beds were firm and comfy and everything you could need was there. A big plus was that our rooms were ready when we arrived on both mornings. The girls at the desk couldn't have been more helpful, from offering recommendations for dining out to giving directions to attractions. Another plus is that there is a taxi stand just across the corner, making it very convenient for getting to the port or airport. I should point out that there are about 10 steps to negotiate with your luggage before you get to the small elevator, so this could be a problem for those with poor mobility. Barcelona isn't my favorite city, but the Hotel Continental Palacete is definitely my favorite hotel in Europe! I will recommend it to all of our friends and hope to get the chance to stay there again. Thanks for giving us wonderful memories!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Vicki H
Reviews.Content: We stayed here do to a recommendation in Rick Steve's book. It was wonderful! We had a balcony room overlooking Las Ramblas. We loved being able to sit out on the balcony and watch the street below. We did not want a sleek no -character hotel for our trip to Barcelona. The staff was the best. They helped with all our questions and directions. We enjoyed the 24 hr bar and took advantage of the beautiful patio. It was so close to everything and the metrol was easy to catch, as were the busses. We will definitely stay again our next trip. James & Vicki

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Cute Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WhiskyVance
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a Spanish experience this is a great place to find it. A last minute change in plans had us scambling for a reasonable priced hotel close to the Rambles. Friends were staying at "The Continental" on theRambles but they were booked and reccomended their sister hotel "Continental Palace"a few blocks away. What a treat! Our room was a standard plus and had a King bed that was very comfotable, sitting area with table and private bath. Being a "Plus" person I often find European bathrooms a challenge (in Brugge I could only shower 1/2 at a time). While not huge the bath was just fine. This is Barcellona and the room decor was somewhat wild. Included in the price is a Cruise ship style buffet bar with hot and cold dishes with canned beer and wine on tap availale 24 hours a day, a great time and money saver. Unfortunatly a small tour group of Germans cleaned out the beer in short order. There is a beautiful grand room eating area with balconies and free internet. As a side note we visited our friends room at the other Continental hotel, they were in a standard room that was one of the smallest rooms I have ever seen, they had to keep suitcases under the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our time at this quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: funtraveling2
Reviews.Content: We found this little jewel of a boutique hotel from a Rick Steves' recommendation. The 4 of us try to avoid tourist hotels whenever possible, & we were treated well during our 2-night stay. Only 19 rooms! A little on the "cozy" side, but clean & comfortable! If you like pink, you'll really love this place as that is the color motif everywhere you look in the room. It has excellent amenities: a computer adjacent to the reception desk with free internet; a well-stocked large continental breakfast buffet; an intimate, lovely breakfast room; a cute balcony off this room with little tables & 2 chairs for your breakfast dining or sipping a drink at night in a beautiful Barcelona setting; 24/7 all-you-can-eat snacks/drinks (we even used it once for an evening meal after 10 hours of being on the go); top-notch security (have to ring a bell to enter the reception area on the second floor); & a most courteous, helpful staff. And if you bring a Rick Steves' guide book you'll receive 5% off your stay! The Continental Palacete also has a great location with its close proximity to Las Ramblas & an easy stroll to the "block of discord" & the Casa Mila for fantastic views of the modernista architecture made famous by Gaudi. The metro is easily accessible a block away, our mode of transportation with an inexpensive T-10 pass that took us to Montjuic, Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia, etc. Barcelona is a neat city to visit, & staying at the Continental Palacete only made it more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, fancy, well situated, generous buffet and borderline tacky.”
Reviews.Author: Ralph T
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. It is a wonderful place with the balcony from our room overlooking the rambla. Such a great place to have a snack and watch the crowd below. The patio garden at the back was just waiting for those having breakfast as the weather was beautiful and warm. The hotel supplied a generous buffet breakfast which lasted most of the day. I will mention however, that the buffet was not particularly well serviced into the afternoon. This is a great place to stay. A little wrinkle is the shower which is rather treacherous and a good place to take a fall. There is nothing to hang on to and the floor is quite slippery.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chuck B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Continental Palacete just a couple of weeks ago (early October, 2011). The hotel is located at a fantastic location right on the Rambla, a few blocks from the Paza Catalunya. It is also located pretty close to the Passeig de Gracia metro station. The "Block of Discord" and Casa Mila is also a few blocks away. They are across the street from a taxi stand. The staff could not have been better. They went above and beyond to help us and give us advice when we needed it. Their English was outstanding. The 24 hour food and drink buffet was a godsend. While you wouldn't want to use it for a meal very often, it was perfect for some fruit, breakfast or a light snack. It helped us out tremendously as we were adjusting to the Spanish eating schedule. You could eat your food on a cute balcony overlooking the street. The room was mostly good. It was rather small by American standards, but typical of what I have experienced throughout Europe. It was very clean. The wi-fi worked well and was very helpful. The air conditioning also worked well. The room was clean and well maintained. The only negatives were: (1) the walls were paper thin; and (2) the shower in our room wasn't working exactly right. The button that made it a shower (vs a bath) stopped working 5-6 times during every shower. Overall, these were very minor issues and we enjoyed this place tremendously.

Reviews.Title: “great property”
Reviews.Author: frannie1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Sept 15th for 1 night pre cruise on carnival magic . The hotel arranged to have us met at the airport by a cab at 07:30 on the morning of arrival . The driver was there as requested and we were at the hotel by 8:30 . This is a very unique property with great character Since the room was not ready yet we stored our luggage in a locked room and proceeded to go to a very lovely all included buffet. The staff are wonderful at this property . Anything we wanted they provided . The room we were assigned was a small room on the 2nd floor . The staff helped with getting our luggage to the second floor . The room was air conditioned and very clean . As stated b4 it is very pink but that didn't bother us at all . After a short rest we were ready to tour barcelona . We found the hotel well situated for walking around . The front desk arranged to have the same driver who greeted us at the airport pick us up and take us to the cruise ship the next day . He was a wonderful chap very friendly and told us all about his city on the route to the ship. If we are ever in barcelona again we will stay at this property for sure

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: sueandlen
Reviews.Content: On the corner of the Ramblas, around the corner from Catalunya square, this hotel has location. Wow factor decorating, helpful staff, help yourself food all day, this hotel had everything we needed. Good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel....has Everything plus a great location”
Reviews.Author: voconnor2
Reviews.Content: A friend and I spent 5 days here just last week and I must say that I have never has a nicer experience in a European hotel. The staff is efficient, friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but extemely well appointed and perfect in every way. The baths have been modernized and are of good size. Ours even had a tub, a rare thing in Europe. Two computers were availabe for use in the lobby. There is a large salon for sitting around chatting with friends and three large windows that open up to a small patio where one can sit and have a drink while overlooking the upper part of the Ramblas. The neighbourhood is very upscale and safe yet accessable to everything. It is two blocks from Place de Cataluyna where everything sets out from. The hotel features a 24/7 hr. free buffet which has everything one could want for a good breakfast, a light lunch or evening snack. This hotel is simply a jewel and one that I will always reccommend to friends travelling to Barcelona. Thank you to the wonderful staff there for an exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “If you can handle the Pink - its a great location - loved the snack bar”
Reviews.Author: Marksails
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hotel Continental on Las Ramblas for a pre-cruise overnight. Loved the location - Staff was very helpful and friendly - held our luggage till the room was ready. Great little snack bar included with room rate - has fruits,cheeses, pasta, salads breads etc. Previous reviewers indicated it was picked over - I felt that they just didn;t put too much out at a time - to keep it fresh. They also offered a slew of soda selections, juices white and red wine and Estrella Beer. It was great to grab a beer and then watch the action below from our balcony. Only negatives were - the room is pink - like very pink - no biggie to us but some might not like it.. Bed was pretty hard - and AC was very confusing to operate. Nothing against the hotel - just warning others. We really loved the location - right in the heart of all the action. A few blocks from the Gothic Section - easy to get to from the airport via the metro. We'd stay there again - in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “A true hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Juud_and_Mark
Reviews.Content: When you walk into this hotel you immediately feel like you stepped back into time. It looks stunning, and better then many hotels I have stayed in that where double the price. The rooms are nothing special, but clean and well maintained. They hold a bed, flatscreen TV with satellite, fridge, bathroom with a bath and hairdryer. Peter from the reception desk goes out of his way to make your stay a pleasant one, and is a native English speaker. There is also a 24/7 buffet, that is great for snacking. It holds a variety of fruit, cereal, snacks and pasta's. There is also a wine dispenser that actually hold fairly good wines and there are free cans of soda and beer. All in all an amazing deal for a hotel located smack down in the center of Barcelona. Sure you can find a few cheaper ones, but be prepared to travel to the center by subway or bus then, and don't expect a free buffet. This is my hotel of choice when traveling to Barcelona, bar none.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Splendid Place”
Reviews.Author: David19777777
Reviews.Content: Very beautifully restored ancient palazzo in the very heart of Barcelona. Took last room they had/ Nice reception/ They say they are 3 stars, could pretend they are more, with all small luxuries and amneties -- the owners have thought of everything their guests might need to set up the hotel room/ Recommend to everyone who wants to try the flavour of real Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Special Place for a special trip !”
Reviews.Author: jojosgranny
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 5 ladies from 18-62, We had a lovely suite with 2 beds in one room and 3 cots in the Versaille Lounge. The location is wonderful and the decor makes you truly feel like a princess. The staff was great - Thanks Christina, Vivienne and Schukot (?) The buffet was a nice bonus with coffee, snacks, wine and beer. We would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - best of our trip!!”
Reviews.Author: MooshiPalmdale
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!! We stayed at 4 hotels in the last 3 weeks and this was our very favorite!! We stayed here for 3 nites prior to our cruise and the location is perfect!! It is a easy 3 block walk to Las Rambles, we visited friends who were staying at their sister facility Continental but I loved this one. It has good location but not the noise of staying on Las Rambles. It is a beautiful restored 1800's mansion that used to be a private home, they only have 19 rooms but it so full of charm and elegance! Beautiful chandiliers, mirrors, crown moldings, and fireplaces. Typical small european rooms but we were luckily upgraded to their suite due to 3 in our family, we loved it!! We enjoyed their breakfasts and 24 hr available drinks and snacks. Great to relax with a small snack and drink after a day of sightseeing before heading out again! The staff was so warm and helpful with sightseeing and restaurant recommendations. Lovely gelato across the street and 2 great nearby tapa bars that were fabulous. The staff held our luggage for us the morning we returned from our cruise until late afternoon for no charge so we could see more of Barcelona before we went to the airport. We can only hope to return to this hotel in the future! I highly recommend it and thank the very kind staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: out4goodtimes
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very friendly and accommodating. The room was very nice and the 24 hr buffet certainly helped keep our food costs down while visiting in Barcelona. The staff took care of our luggage for us after we checked out because we had time before catching a train. The taxi stand just across the street was convenient. The hotel is very well situated. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest hotel!!!! URGE ALL TO AVOID!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LTY86
Reviews.Content: Dishonest hotel despite the all-smiling and friendly reception. Lied saying my reserved room is spoiled by the previous occupant and tried to con me into a small pathetic room by offering discounts. Having no choice I agreed to taking up the small room only to discover that the room has no basic amenities like TV, phone, proper bathroom. I suspect that the room that they offered me is a maid's room or staff rest room. Angered by that, I confronted the front desk. The actually truth is the hotel is overbooked and there is no more room thus putting me into a makeshift converted room. After I discovered their evil plot and complained to the reception, then only they are willing to admit the truth and offer to put me into another hotel for free. Totally disappointed by the dishonest way of doing business and no amount of compensation can make me feel better!!! Wasted my precious time in Barcelona in arguing with the hotel and shifting around. I will NEVER EVER return to this dishonest hotel and urge all to avoid them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: numbr2crooz
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hotel Continental Palacete. Great location, nearly all the sites within walking distance, old world charm, free drinks and buffet (delicious fresh fruit), free internet, quiet rooms, great restaurants within a block, friendly staff. We will definatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Phillie_gal
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our Mediterranean cruise. We went to the hotel directly from the airport arriving around 11AM. They had a room ready for us by 12:30. Yampalin described this hotel perfectly in his or her review. We couldn't have been more pleased with the wonderful staff and great location. Loved the decor! The 24 hr buffet foods was certainly adequate.

Reviews.Title: “For those who appreciate comfort, elegance and tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Yampalin
Reviews.Content: Having been in Barcelona many times with my wife at three different hotels, all very good and worthwhile (two Best Westerns and Comtes de Barcelona), decided this time to try smaller independent hotels, so searched the entire city center using Venere and gtahotels listings and maps, until finally deciding on Contiental Palacete, a small family hotel in one the choiciest sectors of the Ramblas Catalunya. The hotel may be viewed in detail on its own website, showing pictures which faithfully reflect reality. The rooms are of three sizes, we took a mid sized room (137), with a closed balcony on the Ramblas Catalunya street, very well protected from the noise. Hotel offers a 24hr excellent full buffet for breakfast and either a light lunch or dinner, with more than enough liquids to satisfy all tastes, including water, orange juice, milk, and a wide variety of sodas and coffees). The room came equipped with a flat screen television with radio, alarm clock, hair dryer and free internet (wifi and cable) using your own computer or two available from the hotel. But what we appreciated most was the decoration, original Versailles/Vienna styles in the public areas. The hotel resulted from the adaptation of a private home moved to its present location in its entirety, faithfully replacing every single piece to match the original construction. Although we visited many wbsites offering Barcelona hotels, we decided on Venere.com to make the reservation because of its convenience of use and price, as well as ease of cancellation if necessary. However, reserving directly with the hotel, through its website, or by telephone (skype) and fax is equally adequate and more personal. In our case, we reserved many months in advance with Venere and later cleared up some details and confirmed our arrival directly with the hotel by email and skype. Finally, the family also owns and manages the Continental Barcelona hotel about 1 block from Plaza Catalunya (Palacete is 3 blocks away) on the Ramblas itself. A little larger and not so elegantly decorated, it is usually full because of its proximity to the Ramblas. We preferred the Palacete and would again choose it on a return trip. For photos, visit hotel's website.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: Sreep
Reviews.Content: Wow. What a great place. Our room was charming with lots of homey touches - this hotel has been carefully designed down to the last detail to have what the traveler needs. Our room was a little small and hard to move around in, but that's par for the course in European hotels. The excellent amenities made up for it. Best is the 24-hour food line - hot food, fruit, desserts, beverages, even wine - available 24 hrs. a day and part of the price. Big beautiful common rooms, a staff that is professional and helpful, and located right near La Rambla and some Gaudi buildings. We found this in Rick Steve's tour book and once again, his recommendation was perfect. I'd love to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Catsanastasia
Reviews.Content: See also my review of The Hotel Continental which is the sister hotel to this one for details of location, amenities, etc.. We stayed in both hotels over our extended 17 day/16 night trip in Spain. 3 nights at The Continental & 11 nights at The Palacete. Our original plans were changed (to say the least) since I was in the hospital in Barcelona for the last 8 days of our trip. This is where the wonderful staff went above and beyond, finding room in the booked hotel for my husband as our stay was continually extended (my husband had to change our flight home 4 times). They even moved the bags for him (they were already packed of course) when room changes needed to be made! They also were concerned about how I was doing and even sent me flowers at the hospital! It was such a relief for my husband to at least not have to worry about his lodging on top of everything else!!! Thank you, thank you Palacete!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's all true, and our stay was wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: Bob/Paula
Reviews.Content: I've been reading others' reviews and they're all true in some ways. There must be a big variety in room confitgurations. Ours was a "Sun" room overlooking Rambla Catalunya, lovely view of the square below and really quiet, not huge but certainly ample space for a couple. We'd be in the "24/7 buffet was a great thing" camp. It's true it changed little over our 4 nights, but did have a good balance of cold (cereals, breads, excellent fruits) and hot or heatable (chicken, eggs, rice, pasta), and a few daily hot souffles and such. Certainly wouldn't want to take all our meals there, but terrific at odd hours when you just want a snack without negotiating the tapas scene. We also liked the decor very much, including the elegant dining/sitting area. Desk staff were super helpful. As many have said, the location is terrific,steps from the vibrant center of Barcelona without the commotion of Las Ramblas, easy access to Metro and bus. A couple of be-awares: Some steps are unavoidable, about a dozen to the elevator (more of a luggage lift) or another dozen to the front desk. Our bed had a mattress of firm foam about a foot thick, in excellent shape but might be a little firm for some tastes.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: 6outofoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite a refreshing change. The staff are super attentive and friendly. Yes the rooms are decorated in a very traditional floral way but the beds are extremely comfortable, there are more than enough towels which are fluffy & the 24 hour buffet and free soft drinks, juice, tea & coffee was brilliant. Yes it is off disposable plates but for the price of the room to be all inclusive as well as free wifi in our room - there can be no complaint! Easy walking distance to the metro or just to walk to any of the features of Barcelona. The dining room is more like a lounge which is very pleasant overlooking the street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: danielles211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just blocks away from La Rambla, due to a computer error our room was unavailable. The hotel went out of their way by making the best accommodations by giving us a suite. There was a sitting room and a bedroom, lots of plugs, and drinks and snacks available 24 hours. These were adequate, but don't plan on eating your meals there. The service was EXCELLENT, the staff spoke english and were the kindest we've met in Europe so far. The room was very pink, older style furniture but very quaint. If you like pink this is the place for you. Air conditioning was better than most and theres plenty of public places to lounge. There was only a deadbolt which worried us a bit but there were no problems. I LOVED the free Wifi everywhere, most hotels in Europe make you pay for it. If I visited Barcelona again I would stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and charming, Bed and breakfast in a palazzo.”
Reviews.Author: rah37
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our trip to Barcelona, and all in all it was a charming B&B, nothing else. The location is very good, close to catalunya square and the Ramblas. We took a bus from the airport to Catalunya square and wheeled our bags a few blocks down to the hotel. Wasn't that bad, just don't carry very heavy bags, as the hotel does not have any bellhop to carry your bags for you and you do have to carry your bags up to the top landing where there is a quaint little pulley to take you upto the main floor. The hotel is very small, must have been an old palazzo residence or made to look like one, as the suite room we stayed in was decorated like a parlor. For 4 people they only have 2 suites which consists of basically a small parlor with 2 roll away beds, a sitting area, and a fireplace, beautifully decorated with gilt mirrors and high ceilings. Leading off this parlor is a small bedroom only big enough to hold a double/queen bed and a small dresser and fridge. Next to the bed is the bathroom which is extremely tight. The room was quaint and looked down onto the street which was quite busy even late in the night. Right next to the suite room was the common dining area, where one can have coffee, tea, sodas and snacks all day long. there were 3 tiny balconies with tables also looking out onto the street, for a blissful morning cuppa. A word of advise, don't expect much in terms of food. It is just a breakfast bar with some snacks throughout the day. The menu never changed, but included egg omelets, boiled,egg quiches, some kind of salads, different dried nuts, cereals, fruits, yogurts,milk, tea, coffee, soft drinks, water and juice. There are only 2 or people working here, one at the front desk, one in the little kitchen behind the snack bar and maybe a maintenance person. Couldn't really complain. Except that when we were back home we got an unexpected high charge on our credit card from them, which after investigating was for broken down air conditioning which was not even our doing. so a word of caution- never give out info about 2 cards. One can walk down all the way down the Ramblas to the waterfront and the Columbus monument. Plus it was a block turn away from Casa Battlo and La Pedrera, Antonio Gaudi's famous residences. Down the Ramblas one can divert to the Barri Gottic neighborhood. The Ramblas is lined with tapas/Paella bars, restaurants and roadside entertainment. The hotel is also close to the red and blue bus lines which is a very convenient way to see Barcelona, and the stops are close to the hotel or get down at Plaza catalunya which is 2 blocks from the hotel. we walked quite a bit down the side streets and main roads to explore. It was just 25 mins away from the airport as well. All in all Barcelona is a fantastic city made so by Gaudi's marvelous designs and a vibrant city on its own as well, with beautiful beaches and nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “A Letdown”
Reviews.Author: seyhey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a single night before a cruise towards the end of Feb. We selected this hotel based on the many reviews in Trip Advisor. We were very letdown. The entry way is not dissimilar to a freight elevator, three flights up, around a corner, through a non-descript doorway around another corner and you enter the very small lobby. There you encounter Peter at the desk. Very polite and friendly (though a bit obsequious). We were assigned our room with balcony overlooking Las Ramblas. The room was overwhelmingly PINK and pretty small, but clean with a decent-sized bath. The bed was exceedingly hard - two twins pushed together to form a "queen". Between street noise and the bed, sleep was fitful, even after the 7+ hour flight from JFK. One of the perks of the hotel is free-wifi, which I couldn't get, but they had a computer in the lobby for guests' use, so rather than being in the comfort of my room to stay abreast of communications, I was in the small lobby. Another perk, based upon the reviews in TA was the buffet and the free beer and wine and cookies, etc. throughout the day, etc. The breakfast buffet was less than enticing, so we settled for dry cereal. Of the other free items, we tried the red wine, which was not "tinto" but some hybrid between a rose and a red. In any case, one sip was enough. We were fortunate though, as I had originally booked three nights, post-cruise at this hotel. I was able to cancel the reservation while there and book the Royal Ramblas thru Expedia (shamelessly using the hotel's computer in the lobby) for substanially less $$. Overall, the location is very good, but I paid over $50 more per night here than I paid nearly directly across the street for our post-cruise stay at the Royal Ramblas, which was a far better and more comfortable property. So, I'd forgo the free buffet and wifi and stay at the Royal. There is free wi-fi at an "Irish pub" just muintes down Las Ramblas and into the Bari Gotic (good snack food, lively staff and customers and decent house wine too). And for breakfast and/or a light lunch there is a quaint little place called Pa Pastes Cafe off Carrer de Santa Anna (directly across Las Rambls from the Royal Hotel). It's in 1 block from Las Ramblas. A very good bet for a light breakfast and light lunch. For a true "local" dinner or lunch that is a good value just a block from Las Ramblas, try Julivert Meu. It's below street level on Carrer Bonsucces and is crowded with locals and tourists alike. It's convenient and cozy and is not an over-priced tourist trap that you'd find on Las Ramblas (e.g. Cerveceris, which was pricey and came complete with an overbearing and annoying "manager" who chose to stand in front of our table and regale us with his tales of Seattle in the 70's any time food was put before us).

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding?”
Reviews.Author: Saffolein
Reviews.Content: 120 EUR for a double bed room, with that standard? Same price as a super nice 4* hotel down the street, right in Plaza Cataluña? Are you KIDDING?? However cute, corky and certainly interesting (and I'm being nice now), you should definitely be aware that this is a dingy 3* star hotel, and NOT perfect for a stay in Barcelona - not for that price!! We fled after one night there, to the hotel described above. In all fairness; if I'd been a student, travelling with an equally poor friend, and the room had been 70 EUR (tops) a night, then it would've been an ok place to stay. The location is EXCELLENT, right by La Rambla and everything, and the entrance looks very nice - rather misleading, if you ask me. The main room smells of old ciggarette-smoke, and the buffet was really scary - even compared to the school cafeteria. It's a 24 h buffet or something, so the food sits there in its pots that are refrigerated, but still... looked creepy with its bulty plastic lids. And on top of that, you had to eat on paper plates and creepy mustard yellow trays... no no no. I'm usually pretty flexible person, but this was my limit. Ok if it were a cheap place, but... The bedroom was cute, indeed, and REEEEEALLY PINK. I like pink! Alot. So that was ok, a fun thing. Bu they really were very very small, and I'm still a very small person of only 5ft /153cm, hehe. But if they would've gone the whole way with the style, it would've been pretty cool. Instead, the drawers were simply transparent plastic boxes. It was so tacky. The view was a nasty old poster or something, with big flowers on, that they had hung on the brick wall right outside the windows. That was kind of funny, actually. :) So we found a different hotel that very night, not bc this one was unbareable or anything, but because we passed by a hotel so much nicer, fresher, bigger, more modern, bigger, and higher standard, for the same price (sure, no food included, but I barely ate anything from Palacete's buffet anyway...).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for City sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: tedleyhorse
Reviews.Content: Charming and a bonus for us! We had originally booked into the Continental Barcelona but when we gfot there - the lift was not working and you had to climb 3 flights of stairs. Not easy for myhusband who has had 2 hip replacements. So. They offered to upgrade us to the Palacete free of charge. The rooms are very pink - like everyone says but you do feel like you are staying in a palace. The 24/7 running buffet was excellent. We only ate out once and decided that the choice of food was just as good at the hotel and free of charge. This saved us a fortune over the 4 days we were there. Within 3 mins walking distance is the stop for the open top bus tour which is right by 2 of Gaudi's famous attractions. A bonus for us was the display of statues by Rodin right outside the hotel in Las Ramblas. All the staff on duty were very friendly and helpful. Although the purpose of our trip was sightseeing - Barcelona has lots to offer everyone! We were not bothered by anyone even though we had been warned about pickpockets.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: KBix1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 3 nights pre-cruise. The hotel was exactly as pictured and what we expected it to be. Very pink and small but adequate room although the bathroom was rather large. Our bed was not comfortable. We like a firm bed but the sides made it feel like you were going to slide off. The service from Peter at the front desk was excellent. He was very helpful and accommodating. The buffet was okay. There were the makings for salads, some cold cuts, cheeses, lots of choices of cereal and breads. There was an egg dish in the mornings that was not exactly to my taste and a pasta at night that was rather bland. But there was enough food to fill the void. Just nothing outstanding and at least the food was included in the price. It was nice to have coffee, beer, wine and sodas available 24 hours. It was a good location. I'm a rather spoiled gal from the midwest who would prefer the comforts of a Marriott or a Hilton so while I really don't have anything negative to post I would just have to say that this hotel was adequate for a precruise stay but certainly not luxurious and more expensive than what we would pay in the US. Our room was 115 euro per night. It was great to have free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “I Would Stay Here 100 Times Out of the Next 100”
Reviews.Author: lindypc
Reviews.Content: When I look for a hotel, especially in a foreign country, I start by looking at other reviews right here on trip advisor. Since we cruise a lot, I'll also look at recommendations on travel websites like cruise critic. I post queries and do a ton of investigation. I then take all the recommendations and find the one that, as retired teachers we can afford that has a great location. Then, if there are perks, like breakfast and internet, voila! I can't say enough wonderful things about this 'pink palace' hotel. We reserved the most inexpensive room (no view but we're never there except to sleep). It was small but SPOTLESS with the most COMFORTABLE BEDS we've ever had in Europe. The people working at the front desk were extremely helpful and this hotel has a 24 HOUR buffet. We only ate breakfast here (wonderful) because there was a Tapas place less than a block away which was to die for. This hotel also had free internet and free drinks (soft, wine & water). And the best part, the location! A 25 euro taxi ride from the airport took us to this hotel on Las Ramblas. Playa Catalunya, the Trafalgar Square of Barcelona was a couple of blocks; from here--we took a bus to Montserrat. We also walked to the Flamenco show and the HOHO buses are around the corner. The Gothic Quarter is also very close as is Mercat de la Boqueria. Oh, and there is an ATM machine across the street. The area is also very quiet at night and, it has an elevator. It was a perfect stay for us and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: disapointe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst I have been too. the rooms were VERY small with a VERY hard bed. the buffet was tasteless and the "hot" food was cold. After one night we moved to silken hotel. a cheaper hotel in better location and fantastik service and rooms. Never go to Continental. we went there because we were recommended it by the newspaper, but the one who recommended can't have been there....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Reboul
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent choice. It is near the center of things in Barcelona at the north end of La Rambla. However, it is very quiet. We chose an interior room which was 130 Euros a night. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The best part of the hotel is the 24 hour buffet which is free. It is always fresh and contain fruit, olives, yogurt, pasta, rice, wine, beer, soda, four types of bread etc. Breakfast includes all of the above plus eggs, souffles, and ham. The buffet is a great money saver as you do not have to pay for a snack etc. There are 2 free computers to use in the lobby. The furnishings of the common rooms are very ornate. The rooms are on the smaller side, but very adequate and contain everything needed.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: AngelinaNina
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed for one night in very very small room on the second floor, without natural light! Small window was covered by curtains and when we put it on a side we looked in someone’s window! And that room cost 135eur. Very disappointing, especially we already stayed at this hotel last year and had a much better room. Only valuable is position of this hotel and that is all.

Reviews.Title: “I am glad we stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: reenie1195
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights before leaving for our cruise. I read all the reviews and am glad we stayed there. Yes, the room is very small but we made out fine. The location is excellent for being close to a lot of things but not too close for noise. Felt very safe. The food bar saved us a lot of money. We enjoyed eating on the little deck outside and watching everything going on below. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The hotel is very European which was a delight. I recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Austriangypsy
Reviews.Content: Even though my husband's first comment when we opened the door to our room was "wow, this is pink!", we loved this hotel. Yes, a bit gaudy with pink flowered wallpaper as other travelers have reported, but who cares? Location was great. Beds comfortable and most importantly, very clean rooms. The complimentary 24 hour snack bar, includes beer, wine, soft drinks and water. That alone was great. The front desk staff was amazing--very nice and helpful. It was not just one person, but the entire staff. Rooms were quiet even though we were right on the Ramblas. We travel alot and I cannot say enough about this hotel. We will absolutely stay there on our next trip to the beautiful city of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: Boytbab
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful. Room also, but felt a little claustrophobic (small/cramped and the small patio is enclosed/covered - only view is up). Either bathroom or carpet must have had mold/mildew as our allergies acted up after showering. Service was excellent though. Staff very friendly/helpful. Also, outdoor seating in breakfast area overlooked the Ramblas. Very beautiful scenery.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a Palace”
Reviews.Author: charlie854
Reviews.Content: Great location, charming hotel, good food and service. Slept like a baby so the bed must have been good. After a long day sightseeing, how pleasant to retire to the public rooms (just like a palace drawing room) and enjoy a glass of wine, cup of coffee, chocolate or other snacks. Room was small but plenty of room for two beds. Loved the experience.

Reviews.Title: “All the fluff to hide the terrible beds. 14" of foam - Terrible.”
Reviews.Author: Rovershack
Reviews.Content: Coco Chanel once said "Luxury must be comfortable; otherwise , it is not a luxury." That being said, all the awesome service, free buffet, and fancy rooms can't hide the fact that some money needs to be spent on the mattresses. My family arrived in Barcelona and decided to splurge for our one night in town. We chose the Continental Palacete from reviews and pictures. From the outside, everything seems amazing. Extremely friendly staff make you feel at home. The free 24 hour buffet with breakfast, snacks, and beverages is amazing. The rooms look awesome. But all this hides the fact that NO money has been spent on what this hotel really needs, a good bed. The furniture in our room was mainly plastic lawn furniture with fancy coverings made for it. Even this could have been overlooked if the bed had been even moderately comfortable. It was as hard as a rock, and upon further inspection (taking off the fancy cover) it was discovered that the mattress is no mattress at all. The mattress was a solid piece of foam 14" thick. Like the kind you would use for camping, but VERY firm and hard. This would probably work for a "back" sleeper, but I am a side sleeper and tossed and turned all night as my shoulders would fall asleep. Hotel Continental Palacete take note, please spend some of that money you charge on decent mattresses. All the fluff in the world can't hide that fact that you can't sleep in ANY hotel if you can't be comfortable. I can not recommend this hotel on this on issue alone. All said, the 220 euro we spent on the room was wasted as we couldn't sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A Stay With The Taste Of Spanish History”
Reviews.Author: Texaspepper
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived in Barcelona from Dallas on the overnight flight. It was about 12:30 PM local time. So getting to the Hotel Continental Palacete was great. First thing you find is a historical Spain palace renewed in to a small hotel. Entering the lower street entry you are faced with getting to the 2nd floor and the main check in lobby. Two choices! Winding marble staircase or a open cage "lift" that will hold on or two people plus about 4 bags. Works fine. Some ladies were a bit hesitant to ride the slow jerky lift. Check in was quick and friendly. Room was just down the hall. Upon entering the room my wife exclaimed "Oh it's all pink. . .I love it." It was quaint, small but very clean and we knew we would not spend much time in the room except for sleeping. . .oh yes, sleep after 14 hours of trans Atlantic travel to Barcelona to hook up with our 15 Day Royal Caribbean Voyager Of The Seas Trans Atlantic Cruise to Galveston, TX on Nov 28, 2008. So we looked forward to 2 1/2 days of exploring Barcelona. Go to bed at 2pm having just arrived in Barcelona, Spain. NO WAY! We got out and hit the bricks. Walking, looking at the most amazing Spanish architecture. Hundreds of people walking the streets at any hour of the day or night. They walk so fast if you are playing "tourist" get out of the fast lane of the sidewalks and streets. OK. Back to the Continental Palacete. The hotel buffet is accommodating. Fresh brewed coffee on demand. Juices. A drink fountain machine for: Milk, Juice, wine (three types, red, dry white and sweet wine) There is a slide open fridge case below holding bottled water, cans of Pepsi, and some wonderful Spanish beer. All part of your all inclusive room price. Fresh breads and cheese, 2 large toasters, 6 kinds of breakfast cereal olives, jams, spreads and more in the cool buffet. It not a dinner folks, but you will not be hungry while staying at Continental Palacete Each morning they cook a Barcelona version of eggs and bacon, ham and potatoes. With free Internet PC in the sitting room you can keep in touch with who ever you need to keep in touch. The large high ceiling grand ball room is the place to sit and met and talk, It has 3 balconies with a small table and 2 chairs where you can sit and sip your fave 24 hours a day. . you choose. Being on massive jet lag we loved the area at 1, 2, 3, am and even found folks (including my wife) there at 4am drinking coffee, juice, wine or having a snack. All in all. The Hotel Continental Palacete is charming and if you don't arrive with unreal expectations you will not be disappointed. We are looking forward to a return stay in Nov 2009 when we once again rejoin the 15 Day Royal Caribbean Voyager Of The Seas Trans Atlantic Cruise to Galveston, TX

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay to see Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: MandM17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on las Ramblas and very close to a metro stop. There is a 24 hour buffet (not a lot of items, but fruit, cereal, pastries and a few meat/egg items that rotate for breakfast or lunch). There was bottled water, canned sodas, canned beer, wine and juice on tap, and a coffee espresso machine available 24 hours a day. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was always friendly and helpful, and the rooms are cleaned daily.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Mike_2009
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in 2 years. It has an ideal location, central to the city and most modes of transportation. We were able to walk to almost everything, and used the Metro or taxis for everything else. Yes, the rooms are smallish, but, hey, it's Europe! And they are very well furnished. If you want an "American" hotel, go to the Hilton. For us the buffet was ideal for breakfast and snacks. I especially liked the self-service cafe con leche and the fresh fruit. I probably wouldn't eat dinner there, but given the endless variety of restaurants and cafes nearby, I wouldn't eat at the hotel anyway. The staff are extraordinary. We felt that they very much enjoyed their jobs and helping us learn about their beautiful city. I have never seen hotel staff laugh so much when dealing with guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Phoenix1181
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days pre-cruise and enjoyed every minute. The beds are a little too firm and the rooms are very pink, but the hotel is a gem! The rooms are small and I wouldn't recommend a long term stay but it's perfect for a couple of days when you're trying to pack in as many sites as possible. The 24 hour buffet was a disappointment but we did manage breakfast reasonably well. We found the coffee undrinkable (it sure wasn't Dunkin Donuts) but the tea was fine and grabbing a bottle of water on the way out the door and a can of beer and some nuts when we came back in was very convenient. The staff all spoke excellent English and we were able to check email using one of the two PC's available for guests. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Most welcoming and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Snowdonia_Holidays
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by a friend who enjoyed the free wine that was availalbe! We enjoyed the warm Catalonyan welcome, the attention to details in the chintzi pink bedroom and the location being 5 -10 mins walk to 2 Gaudi designed houses, place Catalyni (main square). la Rambla. There is no kitchen or dining room, but the hel yourself inclusive buffet is available 24hrs a day and includes cerals, fruit, breads and croissants, salads, meat casseroles, mixed veg. and potatoes. All sorts of drinks - coffees tea, hot choc. Fridge with soft drinks and beers. microwaves available to heat up the food. Fridge and microwave in the en suite room. We were advised to upgrade to a larger room (167 euro/night) by our friends and still the room was just big enough. There were 2 computers with internet access and we were offered WiFi but we didn't need it. We would recommend the Pallacette Continetal to anyone and will use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Triple Room - Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: fool1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights post cruise. We were 3 adults and contacted the hotel directly about accommodating us in a triple room. They suggested a Versalles Room (with Versalles Salon) which was for a Queen Bed and an additional 50 Euros for an extra bed. We arrived quite early in the morning and the Front Desk was extremely helpful and accommodating to us. We were provided with a room to leave our luggage to enable us to start exploring Barcelona. Upon returning to the hotel in the early evening and actually seeing the room, I must say I was shocked at how small the Versalles room and bathroom area was. The extra bed ended up being a cot the size a child would sleep on and less than 1 foot off the floor. It was placed in the Versalles Salon area. Our room did not get cleaned and so by 5:30 p.m. we complained to the Front Desk and they immediately arranged for it to be cleaned. We were put in Room 139 - If you end up with this room please try to have it changed. It is right next to the lounge/dining area. The walls are paper thin and you can hear the television and people talking as well. The Salon area was a large size and the windows opened up for a nice view to the outside. Yes, the hotel is located in a very good location and also provides free WiFi access, and offered a 24 hour buffet. The buffet did not look good and we were afraid to eat anything from it, although we did have refreshments. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Continental Palacete”
Reviews.Author: beachbumsNovaScotia
Reviews.Content: 8 of us stayed at this hotel, from September 12 to the 14th, 2008. We had several types of rooms, and every room was excellent. Some were larger than others, ours had a lovely step down window with two chairs and a table. It was called the Tribune Room. The lovely sitting area with the open windows to the street, was excellent. Yes, this hotel has very pink rooms but only adds to the quaintness of it. We enjoyed it very much, the location was great, the 24 hour buffet with wine and beer, water, soft drinks and food was excellent for a quick snack. The few days we were here, were pre-cruise days and many couples we met were also staying there for the same reason. This hotel was close to everything. We thought the management were excellent and very accomodating, even when they had to refill the white wine pump several times during our stay. We would highly recommend this quaint hotel, and would definitely want to stay here again. Its very secure, has a great lift system for taking your luggage up to your room and feels very luxurious. The price is good as well, and all of our 4 couples had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RetiredinDC
Reviews.Content: Could not have asked for a better place to stay during our visit to Barcelona. The small hotel is ideally located near the Plaza Catalunya, where the airport bus teminates and the central tourist office is located. The room was spotless, the bed firm, the staff incredibly helpful. The hotel provides a 24 hour buffet bar with food and beverages available at no extra cost to guests and a lovely lounge area in which to enjoy them. I have already recommended the hotel to potential visitors to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Most Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: suzonb
Reviews.Content: Nine of us including 3 children ages 9-13 stayed here 2 nights pre-cruise. We had a Sun room, Tribune room, and Versailles room. As previous reviews have stated, the rooms are very pink and the Versaille bedroom is tiny, but it is the most charming hotel and the staff was wonderful! The buffet was ok...children didn't like anything but the fresh fruit. The selection of drinks and bottled water was fantastic. After our cruise, we stayed at another hotel closer to the airport. The next day we took the metro into the Plaza. My brother was pickpocketed. He lost all his Euros, credit cards, driver's license and passport! We went to the Palacete to retrieve something we had left from our stay the previous week. Upon hearing about my brother's misfortune, Peter at the front desk insisted we sit down and have something to drink and he helped bro with contacting authorities and interpreting for him! Peter went well beyond any expectation we had. He is to be commended for his stellar service! We will definately stay at this hotel when we return to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Continental Palacete in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: seven1113
Reviews.Content: The Cintinental Palacete is a lovely place to stay. The furnishings are definitely out of the ordinary and I just thought it was the best. The location is wonderful, convenient to all you will want to see or do. In September i am returning for a few days before another trip and am anxious to be back in the warm, inviting atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great "quirky" little hotel”
Reviews.Author: canadarose1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights pre- cruise, and met up with fellow cruisers here. The location was great, close to Plaza Catalunya, where the Aerobus stops. Staff were friendly, 24- hour buffet, while hardly outstanding, certainly worked well, especiallyfor drinks and snacks after a long day of touring. Free internet was a bonus. The tiny pink room with firm beds was spotlessly clean, and the bathroom was well laid out. We noticed absolutely no noise from other rooms, and the little elevator for luggage was certainly an experience. The price was attractive compared to others in the area, and the amenities made this a winner for us!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location and warm welcom”
Reviews.Author: thorneybont
Reviews.Content: Ended up in this hotel by chance. Stayed in one of the Versailles rooms, which we got at the cheaper room rate for 2 nights with my wife. Hotel is family owned and very welcoming and friendly. Some rooms are small but are very clean and tidy. 24 hour buffet available, which is nice, but a little repetitive if I was staying longer. Amble wine and beer you can help yourself to. Location is excellent short walk from Catyluna train station and the Ramblas down from the hotel and the shops up from the hotel. If I return to Barcelona I will certainly look first at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: PhilBigNose
Reviews.Content: OK - it's very pink (apart from the green bits) + the rooms are not massive. This is a good, clean hotel in a very good location. The staff were friendly and helpful and overall I think it is very good value for money. Room had a safe, fridge and microwave - all very useful. The food on the buffet was not exceptional, but it was excellent to be able to help yourself to a drink or a snack at any time of the day or night. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, where are all the British?”
Reviews.Author: AMSWales
Reviews.Content: November 2 nd 2007 We are still staying at the hotel, having booked for 5 nights. I booked an outside room after reading adverse reviews about the inside rooms. However the room was not available for the length of our stay so we had to spend 2 nights in an inside room. inside room, 233. This was small but had a small window opening onto an inside courtyard, It was clean and comfortable. We were so happy we wanted to stay there but were told we had to move since the room was reserved after our 2 nights. The hotel was full of people mainly going on cruises and mainly Americans. Outside room 137. This was not much bigger but has a covered balcony facing the main road. We had no sleep all night because the road was so noisy. We had to ask to change again and this time were given another room for the last 2 nights. room 129. This had a small window situated at the back. Hopefully it will be quieter. All the rooms were similarly furnished in pink and were very clean and well equiped. The location is perfect. The nearest metro is the Passeig de Gracia which is first left out of the hotel. The buffet has kept us satisfied for snacks and breakfast and we also used the Tapas bar in Cuidad Condal which was very good. We went to a good Flamenco, Opera show in a theatre just at the start of the Ramblas on the right hand side going down the street. We made good use of the Barcelona card too. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings but very clean”
Reviews.Author: LondonStagman
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and the hotel decor in some rooms is a bit of a shock. We struggled to get anywhere that had either 4 in a room - 2 kids, or an adjoining room anywhere in Barcelona. The hotel offered us a room with attached lounge but ommitted to tell us the actual bedroom is a small triangular cupboard off the lounge! It also faces the main road and is noisy at night. Get the right room, prepare for garish colours and you will have a very clean hotel with very friendly service. Beware room 139 with Versailles lounge. Room 137 that we had for the first night should tick all the boxes. Great location and the tapas bar 70-80 metres straight ahead towards the Ramlas, is an amazing restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Beds are hard as a rock!”
Reviews.Author: ROSEOC
Reviews.Content: Positive: A great location and the buffet comes in handy for a snack and for breakfast. The lounge area is nice and has balconies that you can sit and watch the street life. They have free internet in the lobby which is convenient too. Negative: The decor is very over the top and if you love hot pink then this is your place. We orginally got a interior room which was not acceptable, way too small for 2 people with luggage and it smelled. We upgraded to the Tribune Suite so that we would be more comfortable, so we thought. The bed was the MOST uncomfortable bed that I had ever slept on. I asked the hotel and all the beds are the same so we could not switch rooms again. Thank god we only stayed two nights here and we wont be back again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for travelers coming to Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: calligcat
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was our first stop in a 16-day Spain itinerary, and the Hotel Continental Palacete was the perfect way to start the experience. Convenient location, helpful desk staff, free internet, but the two things that stand out are free food (nice variety of food in a cold buffet at all hours, plus beverages and wine on tap, even at breakfast) and a lovely salon in which to eat the free food! Since we were traveling with another couple, the salon became our living room. And what a room! Opulent and extravagantly gilded (the hotel was once an elegant residence), with French doors opening to a lovely view of the street scene below. Our room was also overdone, but since it was really small the result was charming in a funky way. We had an interior room because I was concerned about noise, but the neighborhood was fairly quiet, so don't hesitate to get an outside room. When you arrive with your luggage, look for the self-operated elevator just to the right of the stairway.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quirky!”
Reviews.Author: Bella36
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this very quaint small hotel in July 2007. We booked the Versailles Salon which consisted of a magnificent private sitting room decorated in French Rococo style and a fairly small and VERY pink bedroom, which was scrupulously clean. There is a magnificent breakfast room with balconies overlooking the square where you can relax and watch the world go by. The staff all speak English and are very friendly and helpful. The 24 hour free buffet was a great bonus but you wouldn't want to take all your meals from it as the choice was fairly limited - but what a benefit to have free beer, wine and soft drinks whenever you want them. Even bottles of water to take out for the day are free. We ate out twice at a very pleasant restaurant called Citrus on Passeig Gracia, a 10 minute stroll from the hotel. The hotel is ideally placed for exploring Barcelona and within easy walking distance of Placa Catalunya, Las Ramblas and the shops of Passeig Gracia. We highly recommend taking the Bus Turistica and "hopping on and off" and spending some time at the beautiful town beach of Barcaloneta - lots of beach bars etc. This hotel is not for people who want the modern but souless amenities of a Marriott/Novotel chain - take note some American travellers!!! It is however quaint, quirky, good value and great fun. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Nanatravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were coached as how to get our "cruise" luggage up to the landing on the Lift. You do need to hold down the button to activate the small elevator. Our double Sol room was just off the reception desk area and quiet, as long as the Window was closed. We made the mistake of leaving it open on the first night. It was noisey very late at night as the Spanish and tourists do enjoy the nightlife. The location was perfect for walking and touring. We felt very safe within this area as well. Las Ramblas Catyluna is the quieter end with many sculptures along the parkway. Passeig de Gracia is only a block away as is the Plaza Cataluyna. We enjoyed breakfast each morning including fresh fruit, quiche, meat, breads, juice and coffee. The availability of cold drinks including bottled water was a definite convenience and cost saver. Of course, the buffet is not meant to feed you for 3 meals a day. The hotel is very secure with a video monitoring system and doors are activated by the desk clerk after hours. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Welshlady147
Reviews.Content: We got what we expected! its a lovely building, really old. The rooms are clean and very pink and flowery! The cabinets, chairs, etc are all plastic! I moved a chair and it was so light that I looked under the fabric and it was a garden patio plastic chair! My husband and I didn;t stop giggling! The buffet cutlery is all plastic, the plates are paper or polystyrene, all disposable. The buffet is OK for snacks -don't expect any more but the free drinks section is great. Really useful on a hot day. It is cheap compared to other hotels, in a great location. The staff are very friendly and helpful, all spoke perfect English. free internet on 2 computers and they help you if any problems. Great for printing off boarding passes, etc. The bed was really hard though - i like a firm bed but this was 1ft thick solid foam on a very high metal wheeled base. Not good if you have any mobility problems. i sat on the bed and my legs dangled 9-10 inches off the floor, i'm 5' 4". My husband is 5' 9" and he had problems getting in and out of bed! We didn't really find any restaurants as it was so busy everywhere, even had to queue like crazy just for a Subway. But we'd just done 14 days on a cruise ship and didn't really want any big meals. Therefore the Cont Palacete was great for a light breakfast - make your own toast, with lovely fresh bread. Tea, coffee, orange juice, etc. Good hotel for what we paid. __________________

Reviews.Title: “Overrated buffet”
Reviews.Author: Captioner
Reviews.Content: Definitely funky. The location is good, just a block north of the Placa Catalunya, but the amenities are quirky. It is all about self service -- there are no porters or anybody to help with luggage, and while the staff is friendly, they don't go out of their way to help. The room was comfortable and clean. Ours had an interior balcony, I guess for smoking, but it was tiny and fully enclosed, so it had no view at all. The hotel advertises wifi service, but the signal is too weak to be usable in the rooms. It does work in the common salon, which is an atractive room with real balconies. The big selling point is supposed to be the 24 hour food buffet. It is good for beverages and breakfast, but you would not really want to count on it for your main meals. One fellow traveler, Sneezy McGrazer, seemed to enjoy it. The food gets overcooked and stale, despite the efforts of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Little Pink Palace”
Reviews.Author: JaceyRight
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at this hotel. It's right off of the plaza del sol, so it's centrally located. Also, the 24hr buffet was great. We spent many a late night grabbing snacks. It was also great to grab a bottle of water before sight seeing. The staff were incredubly helpful. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Although I would get a larger room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel unless you have interior room”
Reviews.Author: bcqajbk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for six nights the last week of April and would have loved the hotel if not for being unable to book or upgrade to an exterior room. All of the previous reviews accurately expound on the wonderful features of the property, including the extensive convenience and value of the buffet, the beautiful sitting/dining room, the helpfulness of the staff, and the excellent location. Prior to booking I read reviews that warned that interior rooms should be avoided. I should have heeded the reviews and booked another hotel when I was told that none of the exterior rooms were available. There was absolutely no problem with noise (as stated in some reviews). The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms were very good by European standards. But when the rooms are described as small, this isn't just small by European standards. Our room literally only fit the bed and two tiny plastic nightstands (the room was equipped with a king size bed----it would have been better with a full). Although there is a "patio", it doesn't provide much more space, light or air as the patio is more of a boxed-in cell---no view, no window, no air. In spite of daily attempts to upgrade, we were unable to move as Barcelona was Hopping that week. In sum, unless you truly do not care about the room itself, this hotel is a great choice. If you want to stay in room that is at least a small room by European standards, do not stay here unless an exterior room is available. You will be disappointed (but not surprised). If we had heeded the warning on trip advisor, we would have simply booked at another hotel. So, take the reviews seriously....after three weeks in Europe and eight different hotels, we found the reviews absolutely accurate.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tabmog
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a visit to this hotel, We chose it because we thought it looked a bit different from the usual city hotel. We were right. We (2 couples in our 50's) loved it. From the welcome at the reception...by Peter..he personally showed us to our rooms, then we were shown the buffet. I have to say that I had seen this mentioned on this site and thought.ok. a coffee and snacks...but I was very wrong. There is lots of fresh fruit. rolls, eggs etc. at breakfast, but also 24 hour drinks, meat, fruit, rice and other dishes you can warm up in microwaves. We found this very handy because the weather was awful...lots of rain. So we went out between showers and snacked and relaxed at the hotel. The rooms are very pink but vaery comfortable. we faced the street. i don't know what the inner rooms are like. The lounge where you sit and eat is fabulous. I have never eaten in such a beautiful room. The pictures don't do it justice. It is in a good location, very near the Ramblas but far enough away to be quiet at night. We would certainly go again as we missed so much in the bad weather.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant”
Reviews.Author: Ronno27
Reviews.Content: Excellant value for money. 24hr buffet was a great. Hotel staff were welcoming and helpful. Room was very clean. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: th3_Hybrid
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great stay. Rooms were nice and clean. 24 hr buffet was the best, good money saver. Staff was all friendly and multi-lingual. Definately would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Bethsmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem....got a great deal online and was worth every euro! The 24 hour buffet was well worth it for the beverages alone! After a long day of touring, what a relief to return to the hotel and guzzle diet cokes, water, beer or wine--all FREE! There was always one hot entree--spinach quiche, potato frittata, etc., plus fruit, rolls, etc. all day long....and the chocolate! Wow! The room we had was small and on the third floor so the ceilings were low--if you're tall, request one of the high-ceilinged rooms on the two lower floors--but since we only slept there, who cares! The room was clean and very PINK--but if you want a Howard Johnson or a Holiday Inn, please stay in the STATES! The quirkyness was definitely European--the general graciousness of the renovated palace was reflected in the marble fireplace, the gilded decorations, the statuary, etc. I'm tired of listening to Americans complain about European facilities....if you travel overseas, enjoy what European cities have to offer--don't compare it to America! (have lived overseas for 24 years and am loving every minute!)

Reviews.Title: “Excellonti....”
Reviews.Author: rosstheboss
Reviews.Content: we actually booked into the hotel continental its sister hotel in las ramblas, but for some reason i gave them august instead of september...anyway they booked me into the palacete for no extra cost despite my error which was brill. We probably had the worst room but hey...cant complain it was clean, had air con etc...and best of all free beer and snacks.... I'd recommend it.....

Reviews.Title: “It's all good!”
Reviews.Author: mygirlscats
Reviews.Content: We were just staying one night pre-cruise and booked the Palacete the last minute before departing Canada. What a gem! After two weeks of 3 star hotels in Europe, we weren't expecting too much. The Palacete was far and away the best hotel we stayed in! The decor is decidedly feminine, but not as over-the-top as I was expecting. The room was very comfortable: good beds (got a triple), good air conditioning, and the bathroom was spacious and clean with a decent sized bathtub and a bidet as well as toilet, sink, shower. We also had our own minifridge and microwave, although the offerings in the buffet made it unnecessary to hoard away our own breakfast/lunch foods. Ah, the buffet! What a pleasant surprise! Hot foods, fresh fruit, nuts, sweets, a cappucino/espresso machine...even fresh lemon thoughtfully provided for your tea! There are two computer terminals where you can access the internet free. The breakfast room is very lovely and has small balcony tables as well as larger ones inside the room. The Ramblas starts about a block away (must say that was a disappointment after all the postings...just a hoard of tourists on a pedestrian boulevard with some mimes and a few folks selling live birds and goldfish) so we had no problem at all with noise coming into the room. My one reservation...you do have to lug your bags up a short flight of stairs off the street to reach the teeny tiny elevator that will take you to the lobby proper. The elevator was a hair-raising experience for me...when we checked out I just put my bags in it and met them downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: golf261
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 1 night post cruise in May. We had a nice size room and bathroom, and the air conditioning was welcome. Even though I like flowers and pink, the decor was almost too much for even me. The sitting rooms are very nice, though, and there are small tables on the little balcony which overlooks Las Ramblas. There is a light buffet which was stocked 24 hours, as well as soft drinks, water, beer, wine. It was a short walk to the Bus Turista stop . The staff was very helpful. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pigreco
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the city center of Barcelona, just a block away from Plaza de Catalunya and Passeig the Gracia. All metro lines were just few meters away from the hotel. First day we stayed in a standard room that was nice but a little small; it also had a window on an inner yard with another palace very near.
