But the other three days we had a "Sun-Sol" room very much bigger and facing on Rambla de Catalunya. The furniture is all in dark pink with flowers and it was nice and funny. The 24-hour buffet is a plus!!! Being in the city center you can come back at the hotel for lunch and then go again. Rooms are very clean and so the rest of the hotel, and no sound or noise comes from outside. A special mention to the staff that has been very kind with us and speaks english. We recommend Continental Palacete Hotel to everyone that wants a very good hotel, with the best position in town and that romantic atmosphere we liked so much. If we ever come back to Barcelona we will surely come back there!!

Reviews.Title: “5 night”
Reviews.Author: newnana
Reviews.Content: As posted in othter review, the decorating is unique, but as far as I am concerned that added to the charm and fun of staying at this hotel. It was nice to have access to food and beverages throughout the day. also the internet in the lobby was very convenient. we had to change rooms and were given a bottle of wine for our inconvenience. We liked the location out of the hustle and bustle of the rambla area, but still convenient. I liked the fact the room had plenty of light and places to put things when we unpacked. I enjoyed meeting other guests in the sitting room but one could certainly choose not to be social if desired. The entire staff was helpful. Great place. It did take my husband a bit of time to adjust to the decor - but not a big deal

Reviews.Title: “charming!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vicamur
Reviews.Content: Lovely!!!! I stayed here for 6 nigths and enjoyed everything. Food was good but it needs a little more choices, if you stay more than 3 days you may get tired of the same (if you are on a budget like I was can't complain). But I have to say that I enjoy the beds, staff always eager to help, close to everything, very clean. I loved that I paid my bill ahead of time and didnt have to worry of any extra charges (only paid 5 euros at check-out for the phone calls). The only problem I encounter was that I have to climb the stair with my heavy suitcase. When I arrived I try to use the lift to go up but was not able to, I still wondering if I was doing something wrong but I didnt get an answer on the phone provided at the bottom of the lift. The day that I left the counter attendant help me with it. Overall and for the price and the service, I recomend this charming hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel i will return to”
Reviews.Author: sarpl
Reviews.Content: we stayed a week in this hotel. a small hotel,with great service. an excellent hotel suprim location very clean and pleasant

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Brilliance”
Reviews.Author: WorldAtSea
Reviews.Content: This may not be a luxury hotel but it us an amazing gem. The staff is incredible. My luggage was dumped in water by a careless cruise porter, and the manager even arranged to have it sent to the only good dry cleaner in the area. In fact we found out he took it himself. The daily buffet is a treat. wine, beer, and the best chocolates too. try the eggs they are magnificent as well. It is all included and done with such warmth. The staff is very knowledgeable and you are in the BEST location possible. Near ramblas, shopping and the double decker bus. YOU MUST do this. Try biblioteque for dinner. See the sights and enjoy. the free internet was great too

Reviews.Title: “Great for pre and post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: spengle1
Reviews.Content: We were a bit taken aback when entering the hotel to see the ver small and interesting self servew elevator. With lots of cruise luggage and 6 adults, it was a comical event to fill the elevator with luggage and send it up to the person awaiting at the top of the stairs. When we checked in with the very helpful Maria, we were able to store our luggage and have a snack at the included buffet while we waited for our rooms to be cleaned. Room (cheapest rate) was small and dark - looked out on an interior mini-patio. Very clean, cute room with good bathroom facilities, microwave and small closet. Very adequate for a 2 night stay when all we did was sleep and change in the room. Would spring for a larger room with window if staying longer next time. Staff was very friendly and helpful, food always available, free Internet access on two computers - one at the desk and one in the hallway near the buffet. We had a very pleasant stay and plan to return in March when we will be staying for a few days prior to a week in Mallorca. Definitely recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great buffet”
Reviews.Author: BrendaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Continental Palacete for two nights in November following a Med cruise. I agree that the free buffet and nice sitting area cannot be beat (try the chocolate covered walnuts). The free internet is a welcome bonus. Our room was rather small for three people; however, the bathroom was a decent size. I did notice that there is a wide range of room sizes, and ours was the smallest I saw. The best room I saw was the suite located right off the sitting room (strangely enough, there is a door right off the public sitting room that goes into the sitting area of the suite.) Our honeymooning friends had that room and it was lovely - definitely worth the few extra dollars they paid for it. The hotel's location is excellent, and within walking distance of many popular sites. The sightseeing buses can be caught just two blocks away. This hotel is a great value and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Where was the elevator?”
Reviews.Author: Egg1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel 1 night post cruise. It is a well located hotel with a charming sitting room and free internet access. I think I read someone describe it as Laura Ashley gone wild, and that was a good description. When I booked this hotel I asked them if they had an elevator and they answered yes. Well, it is about 12 steps to the elevator which takes you to the lobby. There is no one to help you in the lower lobby with your luggage. Then they put us in a room on the second floor. There is no elevator to the second floor. When we arrived at the steps, I asked if they had a room available on the main floor and they said no. So we shlepped our cruise luggage upstairs. On the way in that night, I asked them to tell the manager that it was not a good idea to put people who ask if there is an elevator on the upper floor. About an hour later we were woken from sleep with an offer to change our room. Gee thanks! We were only there for one night. I felt safe leaving my luggage. The desk staff spoke English and were helpful. Free internet access. Free drinks all day was a nice touch. The room was flowery and charming. The bed was hard. Good location. 2 Gaudi buildings only a few blocks away. No elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed for 3 nights in November and absolutely loved it! The location is perfect - a few steps away from the L1 and L3 metro lines, a 5 minute walk from La Ramblas, various shopping centers and Catalunyia, where you can take the train to the airport, and 3 minute walk to the Aerobus. Our room was kept very clean. It is small, though, and walls are too thin, but we've slept really well considering how close we were to the center. The buffet is a real advantage! It is packed with light sodas, juices, beer, vegetables, fruits, snacks and toasts you can just take. No need to wake up early to catch the breakfast as it is always there for you (day and night, 24/7). The staff is nice, available for any question and seem very knowledgable. They were happy to keep our stuff in a side-room until our late flight and offered us to enjoy the Buffet while waiting. Overall, this is an excellent choice for anyone wanting to enjoy Barcelona by foot. The location and Buffet saved us money in transportation and refreshments, so we could spend more on clothes :-)

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: tracy23
Reviews.Content: just returned from staying at this hotel, though only for one night we really enjoyed this experience. The 24hour Buffet is great and includes wine and beer, which was very welcoming when we came in from the bars. Rooms are small and pink, but ok. Great location for the city

Reviews.Title: “Good three star with 24hr buffet”
Reviews.Author: oldcrock
Reviews.Content: 3 star hotel in a great location, clean, safe and calm. Rooms are small, beds are short (anyone over 5 foot 10 inches) may find feet out of the end of the bed). Buffet is limited but get some cheese/ham from a local supermarked, store in room fridge and you will have every thing for a picnic (bring a picnic box and a small freezer pack). Free wine, beer, bottled water, cans great. We would come back during the day to rest and restock. It is a good three star hotel. I booked the suite and the extra space was great for relaxing after a hard day. Go to see Barca play if you can, great views from top floor restaurant/cafe of Corte Ingles and sit at a pavement cafe on the Ramblas for people watching paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hello, we want to say that this hotel is dirty, filthy, disgusting, revolting and much more!! Oh, my God!!! Rooms are decorated with a strange and suspected pleasure. The buffet is 24 hours free and now we can understand this marvelous aliments offered to clients. What a salty soaps! What a burned rices!! What a delicious green cheese!!! And all these aliments are cooked in microwave!!! When I arrived at home I was really unhappy with this simply terrible hotel! Don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Princesses at the Palace”
Reviews.Author: frieda
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two young daughters for four nights and thought this hotel was just right for us! 24-hr buffet is terrific for kids, decor is fun, rooms very clean and comfortable. Exterior "Sun Room" with two cots did not seem too crowded for us. This location is unbeatable. We recommend "Tablao Cordobes" for a flamenco show and Julia Tours is just a few blocks away if you want to book a tour. The hotel has all of the info you would need for this.

Reviews.Title: “The Palacete rules!”
Reviews.Author: cbagintex
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Palacete for five nights at the end of September. We liked the hotel a lot. It has a great location at the top of Las Ramblas, but we had an interior room, so it was very quiet. It was also within easy walking distance of the Block of Discord (with the 2 Gaudi buildings). Our twin-bedded room was tiny, but adequate to our needs, and there was one English-language station (CNN) on the tiny TV (useful for keeping up with the news). Our room had a small closet for hanging clothes and a small fridge (strangely located in the closet, but...whatever). We also had plastic bedside tables that doubled as little chests of drawers. The decor was sort of in-your-face floral. Spotlessly clean. The only drawback to the room was that while we had a little deck off our room in the interior courtyard, there was a dead bird on the chicken-wire-type canopy above it; we just kept the door shut (and the AC on) the whole time, so it wasn't an issue. The bathroom was HUGE, by European standards; you could've practically held a square dance in it! The 24-hour buffet is really just snacky-type food, but the free soft drinks, water and beer are a real plus, as is the beautiful salon/common room with windows overlooking the Rambla Catalunya. There is also free wine on tap, but...it wasn't to my taste--VERY sweet! There are two public computers for guest use, one on the check-in desk (stand up to use it), and one near the salon (with the tiniest keyboard i've ever seen, but this terminal had a chair). We found the staff to be polite and helpful. I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SusanM2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Palacete for two nights in Sept. 05. The location was great (2 blocks north of Placa Catalyuna), very convenient to Las Ramblas and also to catch the airport bus as well as subways and city busses. We enjoyed the 24 hour refreshments and the lovely 'salon' to eat them in. Our room was small (we had chosen this size of room so it did not come as a surprise, but we did find ourselves tripping over each other and our luggage.) If staying longer than 2 days, I would recommend a larger room. It was quiet as it faced the interior courtyard, so very nice for sleeping. The bed was short (I don't think it was even 6' long as my husband's feet hung over the end, although it was a good width, but a hard bed.) Some of the furnishings are a little different than we are used to (eg. the plastic storage 'dressers' for clothing), but otherwise, the room was nicely decorated. The staff were friendly and a few spoke English well. Based on the amount that we paid, I think it was a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better deal in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mitzi123
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel continental Palacete on September05. I can only praise this hotel for it´s great value for money, superb location, FREE 24h buffet & friendly staff. Don´t hesitate & book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kgholtz
Reviews.Content: While the hotel is in a great location, some of the staff were very rude and unhelpful. We needed assistance on a couple of occasions and the girl at the desk was annoyed that I was taking her away from a phone conversation with one of her friends. While the price is right and the breakfast and 24hr. food service was convenient, the beds were hard and the rooms pretty small.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of 8 people stayed 3 nights and loved the friendly, homey, feeling of the hotel. The staff is most accommodating, the location is excellent, the rooms are clean and remind you of Old World design. Having an open buffet round the clock added much to our comfort. We would recommend staying at the Continental Palacete to anyone wanting a small, intimate, well run hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Continental Palacete
HotelInfo.Address: Rambla de Catalunya, 30, 08007 Barcelona, Spain
